name: Victor Vasarely
bio: Hungarian-French artist considered the father of Op Art. Pioneer of geometric abstraction and optical illusions, creating works that appear to move and vibrate through precise mathematical patterns.

name: Bridget Riley
bio: British painter renowned for her black-and-white geometric patterns that create optical illusions of movement. A leading figure in the Op Art movement with works that challenge perception.

name: Richard Anuszkiewicz
bio: American painter known for his vibrant color relationships and optical effects. Master of color theory who creates intense visual experiences through complementary color interactions.

name: Carlos Cruz-Diez
bio: Venezuelan artist who explored color as an autonomous reality. Pioneer of kinetic and optical art, creating works that change appearance based on viewer movement and light conditions.

name: Jes√∫s Rafael Soto
bio: Venezuelan kinetic artist who created immersive installations and sculptures. Known for his penetrable works and optical vibrations that engage viewers in dynamic visual experiences.

name: Yaacov Agam
bio: Israeli sculptor and experimental artist who pioneered kinetic art. Creator of transformable paintings and sculptures that change appearance from different viewing angles.

name: Josef Albers
bio: German-American artist and educator famous for his 'Homage to the Square' series. Influential teacher and color theorist who explored the interaction and relativity of colors.

name: Edna Andrade
bio: American artist known for her geometric abstractions and optical effects. Created precise mathematical compositions that explore visual perception and spatial relationships.

name: Marina Apollonio
bio: Italian artist and member of Gruppo N, pioneering programmed art and kinetic installations. Creates dynamic visual experiences through systematic geometric patterns and optical effects.

name: Wojciech Fangor
bio: Polish painter who developed a unique approach to optical art through soft-edged forms and color gradations. Created immersive environments that challenge spatial perception.

name: Francis Celentano
bio: American artist exploring systematic color relationships and geometric progressions. Creates complex visual systems that demonstrate mathematical principles through optical effects.

name: John Aslanidis
bio: Contemporary Australian artist creating vibrant optical paintings with repetitive geometric patterns. His works generate visual vibrations and afterimages through color interaction.

name: Luis Tomasello
bio: Argentine artist known for his chromoplastic atmospheres - relief sculptures that create changing optical effects through light and shadow interaction with geometric forms.

name: Richard Allen
bio: British artist creating systematic geometric compositions with precise mathematical relationships. His works explore optical phenomena through carefully calculated color and form interactions.

name: Susie Rosmarin
bio: Contemporary American artist known for her vibrant geometric paintings that create optical illusions through color interaction and repetitive patterns. Explores perception and visual phenomena.

name: Frank Stella
bio: American painter and printmaker who revolutionized abstract art with his geometric compositions. Known for his shaped canvases and systematic approach to color and form relationships.

name: Getulio Alviani
bio: Italian artist and founding member of Gruppo N, pioneering kinetic and optical art. Known for his aluminum reliefs and light-based installations that create dynamic visual effects through viewer movement.

name: Peter Sedgley
bio: British artist known for his concentric circle paintings and kinetic light sculptures. Creates mesmerizing optical effects through systematic color progressions and geometric patterns that appear to pulse and vibrate.

name: Francois Morellet
bio: French artist known for his systematic geometric compositions and mathematical approach to art. Pioneer of concrete art who created works based on chance operations and geometric rules.

name: Tadasky (Tadasuke Kuwayama)
bio: Japanese-American artist famous for his concentric circle paintings that create intense optical effects. His precise geometric compositions generate visual vibrations and afterimages through color relationships.
